data.label:
Narrator

I had invited Vina on a yacht trip from Topes out to view the Esqiris gas field.

Player_Romus

"What a pleasant surprise. Vina, why didn't you tell me you'd be bringing company?"

Narrator

Manus cleared his throat.

Narrator

Manus nodded at my daughter.

Vina Toras

"We've been corresponding since then. And speaking on the phone when we've had time."

Player_Romus

"Because of Pales."

Manus Sazon

"I confess, I withheld my feelings at first, fearing reprisal from the King. Yet the more we spoke and wrote, the more I realized what a fool I'd be to walk away from such a beautiful, inspiring woman."

Player_Romus

"No. Absolutely not."

Vina Toras

"But...?"

Narrator

Vina struggled to remain calm.

Player_Romus

"But I would ask that we only make the relationship public once Vina returns from Pales."

Player_Romus

"Because any children this union produces will carry the last name Sazon. The Toras dynasty will be destroyed."

Player_Romus

"But if this union produces children, it will destroy the Toras dynasty."

Narrator

Vina's eyes sparkled.

Player_Romus

"But I would kindly ask you to consider going to Pales regardless. I'm sure Mr. Sazon will still be here when you return."

Player_Romus

"Because your boyfriend here is trying to destroy the Rizian monarchy."

Narrator

As the small craft pulled up alongside my yacht, I realized my daughter wasn't alone.

Vina Toras

"Hello, Father."

Player_Romus

"Good idea. We three have a lot to talk about."

Pales Talk

Pales Talk

Player_Romus

"They are requesting a diplomatic liaison for our gas deal. I said I knew just the woman for the job."

Player_Romus

"It's mostly a symbolic role. Nothing to it, really."

Player_Romus

"You don't have a say in the matter. You're going no matter what."

Player_Romus

"The council would have been no fun for you. Pales will be an adventure."

Vina Toras

"Oh. A little like my current role, then."

Player_Romus

"If you can serve on the council, you can do this. It's good preparation for being queen."

Vina Toras

"I... I'd love to."

Narrator

Manus leaned forward to interject. Vina shook her head.

Vina Toras

"I don't know about that. But if it means so much to you, I'll do it."

Narrator

She looked questioningly at Manus. He nodded.

Player_Romus

"I will respect your decision. I will not force you to go someplace you don't want to be."

Vina Toras

"I... I have no idea what you mean."

Player_Romus

"Pales has been linked to the Friendship Day bombing in Zille. I want you to find out more if you can."

Player_Romus

"If the deal goes south, we'll need leverage. Try and dig up some dirt on the Duke."

Vina Toras

"I can do that."

Vina Manus Relationship Talk

Vina Manus Relationship Talk

Player_Romus

"No buts. Go for it, you crazy kids."

Narrator

She looked at me in confusion.

Vina Toras

"Pales? Why?"

Narrator

She looked at me in confusion.

Player_Romus

"Do I have to have a reason? When I say no, I mean no."

Player_Romus

"What life? I thought you'd appreciate the chance to get away from your old man."

Player_Romus

"I would only ask that we refrain from publicizing your relationship until Vina's return."

Narrator

She looked at Manus. He gave her a reassuring glance.

Vina Toras

"I'll tell you what."

Vina Toras

"Give Manus and myself your official blessing, and I will do as you ask."

Player_Romus

"But I would ask that we only make the relationship public once Vina returns from Pales."

Narrator

Manus reached over and squeezed Vina's hand.

Player_Romus

"But Vina, there's something more important I wanted to bring up with you. About Pales."

Narrator

Manus reached over and squeezed Vina's hand.

Player_Romus

"But in exchange, I want you to agree to go to Pales."

Player_Romus

"You have not granted my request to go to Pales. Why should I grant yours?"

Player_Romus

"You wouldn't have to touch him. Just flirt a little."

Narrator

Vina sighed heavily.

Narrator

Vina sighed unhappily.

Narrator

She glanced unhappily at Manus. He turned towards me.

Manus Sazon

"Your Majesty, you have indicated hat you wish to preserve Rizia's current system of government."

Vina Toras

"That isn't guaranteed to happen."

Narrator

Manus shook his head gracefully.

Player_Romus

"But you might have to go to Pales."

Narrator

Vina and Manus looked at each other excitedly.

Vina Toras

"Not necessarily, Father."

Narrator

She sighed.

Gas Field

Gas Field

Player_Romus

"Then you have my official permission. Just don't get yourself pregnant before marriage."

Player_Romus

"Your *full* cooperation? Including in the House of Delegates?"

Player_Romus

"Your house should be cooperating with me anyway, Mr. Sazon. Need I remind you that I am the King?"

Player_Romus

"You'd let go of your claims, titles, and lands just like that?"

Manus Sazon

"If you give us your approval, you will have House Sazon's full cooperation in that matter."

Player_Romus

"Very well. Once Vina returns from Pales, we will make your relationship public."

Player_Romus

"Let's make a deal. If Vina agrees to go to Pales, we can go public with your relationship now."

Player_Romus

"But I do wonder if Mr. Sazon is truly motivated by love, or by his house's anti-monarchist aims."

Player_Romus

"Your *full* cooperation? Including in Iza?"

Narrator

I looked at Vina. A frown had formed on her face.

Player_Romus

"I am feeling gracious today. You have my blessing, effective immediately."

Vina Toras

"You'll wait for me until my return from Pales?"

Vina Toras

"In that case, Father, I will accept the Pales diplomatic position. As long as Mr. Sazon has the patience to wait for me."

Narrator

They embraced tightly. A content silence descended.

Vina Toras

"Thank you, Father!"

Narrator

Vina sighed heavily.

Narrator

Manus looked at me, his expression serious.

Manus Sazon

"For you, Your Highness, I would wait an eternity."

Narrator

She sighed heavily.

Children

Children

Manus Sazon

"I don't put much stock in names, YOur Majesty. It's my hope that my legacy will live on, even if my name doesn't."

Manus Sazon

"A closer union between our houses will benefit us both, Your Majesty. Even if my name is not attached to it."

Manus Sazon

"And of course, it's entirely your decision."

Manus Sazon

"It can never hurt to have the favor of the King of Rizia, Your Highness."

Vina Toras

"In that case, Father... I will accept the Pales diplomatic position. As long as Mr. Sazon has the patience to wait for me."

Vina Toras

"I suppose not. Thank you, Father."

Player_Romus

"A man who can't pass on his name to his heirs is like an amoeba, Mr. Sazon."

Vina Toras

"Come now, Manus. It's unbecoming of you to grovel."

Narrator

Vina looked directly into my eyes.

Player_Romus

"I cannot approve this union. Vina, you are going to Pales. Mr. Sazon, if I catch you trying to contact her, I will have your head."

Player_Romus

"I am feeling gracious today. You have my blessing, effective immediately."

Player_Romus

"I cannot approve this union. Vina, you are to cut off all contact from this man. Mr. Sazon, if you are ever seen with her in public, I'll have your head."

Player_Romus

"My deepest apologies to you both. But it is politically advantageous for Vina to remain single for the time being."

Narrator

They looked at each other excitedly.

Delayed Approval

Delayed Approval

Immediate Approval If Pales

Immediate Approval If Pales

Vina Toras

"Come on, Manus. We have to get off this ship right this second."

Narrator

She nodded slowly. I saw a dangerous glint in her eye.

Player_Romus

"Feel free to see each other in secret. But we cannot risk angering Rizia's other houses."

Player_Romus

"Please, Vina. If you love your father and this country, you'll understand."

Vina Toras

"All right, Father. I understand."

Player_Romus

"And you know what? I'll graciously allow you to begin dating in public. Effective immediately."

Player_Romus

"It's not your choice, Vina. You will go to Pales. And if I find out that Mr. Sazon has been trying to contact you, I'll have his head."

Player_Romus

"I wish I could approve. But it is politically advantageous for Vina to remain single at this point in time."

Player_Romus

"There will be no discussion. You're going to Pales, and you will break off contact with Mr. Sazon."

Maddest Vina

Maddest Vina

Player_Romus

"It's a deal. Accept this position, and you two can consider yourselves blessed."

Vina Toras

"You could have opposed our relationship, and you didn't. So I'll do as you ask."

Player_Romus

"I'm sorry, both of you. But I can't give you my blessing to be together. It's too risky politically."

Vina Toras

"You mean it?"

Player_Romus

"I do not want my grandchildren carrying the Sazon name."

Player_Romus

"This man's house is brimming with anti-monarchists. I want him as far from the throne as possible."

Player_Romus

"Perhaps He will approve if you agree to go to Pales."

Narrator

Vina blinked.

Player_Romus

"I hope one day that I can find a love as pure as yours."

Player_Romus

"He has ordained that the Toras family will hold the throne for centuries to come. If you bear children with the Sazon name, it will ruin his plans."

Player_Romus

"It depends. Have you been fornicating out of wedlock?"

Vina Toras

"You're asking a lot of me. But I can try."

Player_Romus

"If you swear to abide by His laws and keep Him dear in your hearts... then yes, you do."

Vina Toras

"In the meantime, I regretfully turn down the Pales diplomatic position."

Player_Romus

"I understand. That's your prerogative."

Player_Romus

"And why is that? Maybe some time abroad will help you get a fresh perspective."

Player_Romus

"No, you already agreed to it. You're going."

Narrator

She looked at Manus. He didn't say anything.

Narrator

She looked at Manus.

Player_Romus

"Come. Let all three of us behold the majestic gas extraction capabilities of the Kingdom of Rizia."

Player_Romus

"I'm going to the bow to have a closer look. You may join if you wish."

Narrator

Manus and Vina nodded to each other, then got up from their seats and walked with me to the ship's bow.

Narrator

Even in its partially completed state, the expanded gas field was a sight to behold. Yellow-vested construction workers swarmed over a towering set of metal drilling rigs, connected by a labyrinth of platforms, cables and pipelines.

Narrator

The decommissioning of the gas field was still underway. Yellow-vested construction workers swarmed over the metal drilling rigs, uncoupling cables and dismantling pipelines.

Player_Romus

"See, Vina? This is why it's so important that the Pales deal goes smoothly. We can no longer rely on domestic gas production."

Player_Romus

"See, Vina? This is why you should've agreed to help with the Pales deal. We can no longer rely on domestic gas production."

Player_Romus

"We're really going to need the Aureus field now."

Player_Romus

"Good riddance. The ocean will flourish without it."

Player_Romus

"Make sure to mention this when you're in Pales, Vina. We have our own gas. We're not desperate for the Grand Duke's."

Narrator

Vina blushed furiously.

Narrator

Vina didn't respond. She stared out at the sea in stony silence.

Vina Toras

"So I see. I hope the destruction of marine habitats is worth it."

Vina Toras

"Worth the destruction of marine habitats? I hope so too."

Narrator

Manus grinned and squeezed her shoulder.

Narrator

Manus squeezed her shoulder.

Vina Toras

"Mmm. I don't find anything beautiful about the destruction of marine habitats."

Manus Sazon

"You'd rather we go back to coal and oil? This is the cleanest, safest energy source out there."

Manus Sazon

"Except for my province's hydroelectric dam, of course. You have our thanks for that, Your Majesty."

Player_Romus

"Actually, so-called 'clean' hydroelectric plants still have a deleterious effect on river systems."

Player_Romus

"Greater energy independence is a win for all of us, Mr. Sazon."

Vina Toras

"Ugh. Must you, Father?"

Manus Sazon

"Oh. Well, I still consider it progress."

Narrator

Vina nudged him.

Manus Sazon

"It may not be perfect, but it's progress."

Manus Sazon

"We do. And your eye towards progress."

Narrator

Manus laughed in spite of himself.

Manus Sazon

"But on a more serious note..."

Vina Toras

"Yes, I know. I won't let you down."

Vina Toras

"Maybe it's time we finally got away from natural gas as an energy source."

Player_Romus

"You're dam welcome."

Player_Romus

"See, Vina? Someone on this boat knows how to be grateful."

Player_Romus

"We'll get some energy from that plant. I wish it was more."

Vina Toras

"Agreed. We really ought to find a way to power ourselves without relying on dirty gas."

Narrator

Manus squeezed her shoulder.

Player_Romus

"You dare accuse my daughter of being unfaithful?"

Vina Toras

"He and his entire family are parasites. There's nothing less attractive than that."

Manus Sazon

"Never, Your Majesty. I was joking."

Manus Sazon

"I still consider it progress, Your Majesty."

Manus Sazon

"Yes, both my house and the RPP are happy to see Rizia making progress on that front."

Narrator

Manus chuckled politely. Vina rolled her eyes.

Democracy Talk

Democracy Talk

Manus Sazon

"Speaking of which..."

Vina Toras

"Except yours, love."

Manus Sazon

"No, you prefer your men bookish and sweaty."

Narrator

Vina nudged him.

Manus Sazon

"Come now. Who *isn't* a parasite in your book?"

Manus Sazon

"Now, Vina. Natural gas is the cleanest, safest type of energy there is."

Player_Romus

"But it's non-renewable. We use up this field, and it's gone forever."

Player_Romus

"You're absolutely right. Coal and oil are the past. Natural gas is the future."

Manus Sazon

"Compared to coal and oil, I would call it progress."

Narrator

Manus turned towards me, a strained smile on his face.

Manus Sazon

"I've been doing some thinking since our conversation in Sallabes."

Vina Toras

"We both have."

Manus Sazon

"My house would be happy to help you achieve the reforms you desire."

Manus Sazon

"Unfortunately, my house cannot be relied on to help you achieve the reforms you desire."

Manus Sazon

"I myself, however, am happy to lend what assistance I can."

Vina Toras

"So am I. All three of us want the same thing, Father."

Vina Toras

"Really, Manus? After the way he's treated us?"

Vina Toras

"It's true, Father. Whatever your feelings about myself and Mr. Sazon, you have to admit that the three of us want the same thing in the end."

Manus Sazon

"And to be honest, after the conversation we just had, I'm not feeling very inclined to help you either."

Narrator

She tried to put on a brave face.

Player_Romus

"What I want is for my daughter and my opposition leader not to conspire behind my back."

Player_Romus

"Yes. A Rizia ruled by the common people, not the nobility."

Manus Sazon

"We did not want to trouble you in the midst of your international negotiations."

Player_Romus

"Indeed. For the royal family to shed our legislative responsibilities while keeping our wealth and status."

Player_Romus

"'Revolution'? That's what your comrade Emmerich Hegel said you wanted."

Manus Sazon

"Forgive us, Your Majesty."

Narrator

The Riziania completed a slow circle around the gas field and began heading back towards the Topes harbor.

Manus Sazon

"I'll head out on the dinghy before we reach port. Wouldn't want anyone getting the wrong idea."

Player_Romus

"Make the most of it, kids. Won't be long before Vina ships off to Pales."

Player_Romus

"This is what you wanted. Prepare for Voice of Rizia to tear you to shreds."

Player_Romus

"The gossip columnists answer to the Crown, but they can still be vicious."

Player_Romus

"Of course everyone will accept you. You're young, beautiful and heterosexual."

Player_Romus

"That I'm collaborating with the opposition? Heaven forbid."

Player_Romus

"Don't worry. It won't be long before you can step off the yacht arm in arm with Vina."

Player_Romus

"That the King of Rizia is engaged in a torrid affair with a man half his age? No, that'd be dreadful."

Player_Romus

"Sure. To neutralize the revolutionary elements in this country by giving them a greater say in the lawmaking process."

Narrator

They both nodded.

Narrator

Manus lowered his eyes.

Narrator

They looked at each other. Vina gave a small nod.

Narrator

A look of horror spread across my daughter's face.

Vina Toras

"I-- I was going to tell you. It's not what you think."

Player_Romus

"What I think is that you humiliated me and undermined your government."

Player_Romus

"Relax. I'm not angry. Just disappointed that you didn't confide in me."

Player_Romus

"I had no idea that your hobby interest in communism had gone this far."

Vina Toras

"It's not a 'hobby', Father,"

Vina Toras

"I'm sorry, Father. I thought it was safer that you didn't know."

Vina Toras

"I know, Father. I truly am sorry."

Vina Toras

"For what it's worth... I didn't tell the Chancellor I wanted revolution. I asked him if he thought a country like Rizia could adopt Valgslandian Socialist principles without one."

Player_Romus

"Of course we can. In case you haven't noticed, I've been working day and night to better the situation of commoners."

Player_Romus

"Don't be daft. The aristocracy is blocking our way to true progress, and it is highly unlikely they'll gently step aside."

Player_Romus

"I think I know what his answer was."

Player_Romus

"And? What did he say?"

Vina Toras

"He wrote that you can't heal an infected tooth without tearing out its root."

Vina Toras

"That's what he said. In so many words."

Vina Toras

"But see, Father, Valgslandian Socialism is implemented from the bottom up. Not the top down."

Player_Romus

"Very well, Comrade Vina. Talk to me."

Manus Sazon

"We've had our disagreements about what that means. In the end, Her Highness made a compelling argument for the complete removal of Rizia's aristocratic class."

Manus Sazon

"We both believe that this can be accomplished without fundamentally disrupting Rizia's societal structure."

Vina Toras

"In turn, Manus convinced me that such a transition can occur gradually, without the need for societal upheaval."

Manus Sazon

"You wish to attempt a delegation of legislative control. But such a thing cannot be achieved overnight."

Player_Romus

"Then what do you suggest?"

Player_Romus

"I'm afraid we have no choice. The people want it now."

Player_Romus

"Agreed. However simple it may appear from the outside, it takes unfathomable effort."

Vina Toras

"Besides, Father, the people officially want the monarchy to stay. Remember, the Rizian National Coalition still makes up a majority in parliament."

Manus Sazon

"The House of Delegates is key to this, Your Majesty."

Player_Romus

"You're a sensible man, Mr. Sazon. A good match for my headstrong daughter."

Player_Romus

"Fine. Go on, then."

Vina Toras

"Yes. The royal family should guide Rizians through the transition, not abandon them to it."

Player_Romus

"So you'd ask the aristocracy to just politely step aside? It'll never happen."

Player_Romus

"I thought for a second you two were going to start advocating for a revolution."

Player_Romus

"It's a bad sign that I was never informed. What do I even keep the Golden Guard around for?"

Manus Sazon

"Here's what we were thinking, Your Majesty."

Player_Romus

"You're a sensible man, Mr. Sazon. A good match for my headstrong daughter."

Player_Romus

"You're right. I should have stopped media censorship in Rizia as soon as I took the throne."

Vina Toras

"I appreciate that you kept me out of the papers during my childhood, Father. But I'm not a little girl anymore."

Manus Sazon

"It has been too long since the Rizian people had an information source they could trust."

Player_Romus

"I disagree. Any change has got to be radical, or it's not going to stick."

Manus Sazon

"If we try to reform the government against their wishes, your Grand Vizier could use it as justification to oust you from the throne."

Vina Toras

"Especially with so few people involved. We'll need more support if we want to have a dream of achieving it."

Manus Sazon

"As long as the Rizian National Coalition holds a parliament majority, they will oppose our attempts at reform. And your Grand Vizier could use that as justification to oust you from the throne."

Manus Sazon

"As long as the Rizian National Coalition holds a parliament majority, they will oppose our attempts at reform."

Manus Sazon

"Yes, you can override their objections. But there's the chance that your Grand Vizier will use that as justification to oust you from the throne."

Manus Sazon

"As long as the Rizian National Coalition holds a delegate majority, they will oppose our attempts at reform."

Vina Toras

"We talked about it. But look at what's going on around us. Rizia needs change, but we also need stability."

Manus Sazon

"Go too radical too fast, and you won't live long enough to see it through."

Vina Toras

"I'm standing right here, Father."

Manus Sazon

"Not all at once."

Narrator

We had reached the far edge of the gas field. The yacht creaked a little as it began to turn around.

Manus Sazon

"You could override them as king, yes. But Your Grand Vizier could use that as justification to oust you from the throne."

Player_Romus

"What is there to say? It seems like your mind has been made up."

Vina Toras

"I'm right here, Father."

Narrator

He rested his elbows on the ship's railing.

Manus Sazon

"On the other hand, if the Rizian People's Party were in power, you would have a much easier time of it."

Player_Romus

"First you want my daughter, then you want a parliament majority. Why don't I hand you my crown while I'm at it?"

Player_Romus

"I can't help you with that, Mr. Sazon. If the people want you to win, you'll win."

Vina Toras

"You know that's not how it works. The system is rigged against the opposition."

Player_Romus

"If you win, you'll be the head puppets in our puppet parliament. How will that change anything?"

Vina Toras

"May I just remind you that I'm not yours to 'give'?"

Player_Romus

"You want me to rig the election? That doesn't sound like you."

Manus Sazon

"The system is already rigged. I want you to un-rig it."

Manus Sazon

"Listen. The makeup of the House of Delegates is determined by the outcome of the provincial elections, right?"

Manus Sazon

"Your goals align with the RPP's more often than not. Passing the kind of decrees you want will be a lot easier if we're in charge."

Manus Sazon

"You were the one who wanted change, Your Majesty. It'll never happen with de Rava and the RNC in charge."

Vina Toras

"For the sake of a free press, I'm willing to give up some of my privacy. I just won't read what they print about me."

Vina Toras

"Besides, Father, what do you even have to hide?"

Player_Romus

"Uh, nothing. Definitely no secret affairs or anything of that nature."

Player_Romus

"I most certainly didn't pervert the justice system to serve my own ends."

Player_Romus

"I'm one hundred percent not in the pocket of a gold baron."

Player_Romus

"I'd rather not say."

Player_Romus

"Absolutely nothing. But that's not the point."

Vina Toras

"I do realize that opens us up to more public scrutiny. But I'm not a little girl anymore."

Manus Sazon

"I have one other idea. My party has millions of sympathizers in Rizia who cannot vote for us because they are not citizens."

Narrator

Manus and Vina politely pretended not to hear me.

Player_Romus

"Now you're *really* trying to get me overthrown."

Vina Toras

"Giving up some of our privacy now will be worth it in the long run. I bet the papers won't even care about us royals once we're merely symbols."

Player_Romus

"You're probably right."

Player_Romus

"You'd be surprised."

Manus Sazon

"A haphazardly executed one will fail. And then nobody will be satisfied."

Manus Sazon

"And as you know, there's an election coming up."

Manus Sazon

"For a start, it will be a lot easier to pass progressive decrees if we're in charge."

Player_Romus

"A sound strategy. The RPP would be able to increase its voter base overnight."

Player_Romus

"That's a rubbish tactic. The backlash from real Rizians would cancel out any benefit you got from the foreign vote."

Manus Sazon

"Rumburgians and ethnic Valgs would lean monarchist. But if we mobilize the Wehzek, Derdian and Morellan base now, we should gain enough votes to come out on top."

Manus Sazon

"'Real' Rizians, Your Majesty? What do you call the children of Wehzek civil war refugees who have never known any other home?'"

Manus Sazon

"I know it's a risk. Especially with Su Omina on the rise."

Manus Sazon

"Such an act wouldn't only benefit my party, you know. Quite a few Rumburgians and ethnic Valgs will opt for the Rizian National Coalition."

Manus Sazon

"But if we start moblizing the Wehzek, Derdian and Morellan base now, we should gain enough votes to come out on top."

Manus Sazon

"Rizia is a multicultural country, Your Majesty. It's time for our government to reflect that."

Player_Romus

"Vina, what do you think of this idea?"

Player_Romus

"Leave me to handle Su Omina."

Player_Romus

"I'm uneasy about this. I fear Rizian national identity will become diluted if just anyone can become a citizen."

Player_Romus

"Having the interests of the working class represented in government is more important to me."

Narrator

Vina straightened her back.

Vina Toras

"I think it's long overdue. And it's the fastest way to get Mr. Sazon's party into power. But at the same time..."

Manus Sazon

"Rizia's foreigners mostly belong to the working class, Your Majesty. So this will accomplish both."

Manus Sazon

"Perhaps the acceptance of different opinions and cultures should be part of our national identity, Your Majesty."

Vina Toras

"Manus, I know we talked about this, but..."

Vina Toras

"I confess I'm worried about increasing numbers of Golcondists and Dastnurists participating in elections. What if it sets back the progress we've made on women's rights?"

Vina Toras

"At the same time, Manus..."

Player_Romus

"Don't worry. I am still the king, and I make the rules in the end."

Player_Romus

"We shouldn't assume all Derdians and Wehzeks hold those beliefs. Many moved here to get away from them."

Player_Romus

"Relax, Vina. The foreign vote will boost the RPP, but they're still far from the majority in this country."

Vina Toras

"I suppose you're right, Father..."

Player_Romus

"A legitimate concern, my daughter."

Manus Sazon

"Vina, as long as I'm still speaker of the RPP, I will preserve the gender equality laws your grandmother made."

Manus Sazon

"And those made by your father, of course."

Narrator

Manus gave her a confident smile.

Vina Toras

"Well, Father? What do you think?"

Player_Romus

"I see through your transparent power grab. Frankly, it's making me question my decision to allow you to date my daughter."

Player_Romus

"Please. Call me Dad."

Player_Romus

"You may call me Romus."

Vina Toras

"Please don't, love."
